com.example.ARmirrorS.Server.Socket

Class OpenCVServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.java_websocket.WebSocketAdapter
      • org.java_websocket.AbstractWebSocket
        • org.java_websocket.server.WebSocketServer
          • com.example.ARmirrorS.Server.Socket.OpenCVServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable, org.java_websocket.WebSocketListener

    public class OpenCVServer
extends org.java_websocket.server.WebSocketServer

    Class OpenCVServer

    Class OpenCVServer handles All processing related to Server opening, closing, errors, and messages received from clients. It is also responsible for broadcasting Setup parameters for mirror and tiles, and determining which client should be assigned as MASTEr and which is assigned the role of SLAVE.

    Since:
    2019-12-05
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Yussuf Khalil, Daniel King, ykhalil2@illinois.edu, dking32@illinois.edu
    See Also:
    ClientHandshake, WebSocket, WebSocketServer

      • onOpen

        public void onOpen(org.java_websocket.WebSocket conn,
                   org.java_websocket.handshake.ClientHandshake handshake)
        called when a new connection with a client is established. It also determines if the client connected should be treated as a Master or Slave based on the number of clients already attached.
        Specified by:
        onOpen in class org.java_websocket.server.WebSocketServer
        Parameters:
        conn - reference to websocket connection to client.
        handshake - ---NA---

      • onClose

        public void onClose(org.java_websocket.WebSocket conn,
                    int code,
                    String reason,
                    boolean remote)
        called when the socket with the client is closing. Used to update the number of clients connected to the server and relese the reference to the Websocket object of the Master client.
        Specified by:
        onClose in class org.java_websocket.server.WebSocketServer
        Parameters:
        conn - reference to websocket connection to client.
        code - connection close code (normally 1000).
        reason - text description of the closing reason.
        remote - flag to indicate close initiation.

      • onMessage

        public void onMessage(org.java_websocket.WebSocket conn,
                      String message)
        Handle String messages received from Client. It broadcasts the new parameters for slaves and send so they can view what the master client has chosen
        Specified by:
        onMessage in class org.java_websocket.server.WebSocketServer
        Parameters:
        conn - reference to websocket connection to client.
        message - setup message received from client.
        See Also:
        WebSocketServer.onMessage(WebSocket, ByteBuffer)

      • onMessage

        public void onMessage(org.java_websocket.WebSocket conn,

      • getServerStatus

        public String getServerStatus()
        Displays the initial ip address and port of the server. It also displays the status of the streaming masked frames from server to client.
        Returns:
        serverStatus | status of the server.

      • getClientStatus

        Returns:
